title: How were the 'seven wonders of the ancient world' decided? Why only this seven? - Quora

response.answer_text: The seven wonders of the world were listed by Herodotus, as part of his guidebook to the eastern Mediterranean. He never went any further than that, which is why the number stops at seven. In the Afterword to the book, he says that he’s planning a second volume to cover the world beyond the Pillars of Hercules, but it never came out: I guess the sales of the first one weren’t encouraging.
